content:
TITLE: Installing Requirements using pip
DESCRIPTION: This command installs the necessary Python packages listed in the `requirements.txt` file.  This file should contain a list of Python packages and their versions that the Step1X-Edit project depends on. This command ensures that the environment has all the necessary dependencies for running the image editing model.
SOURCE: https://github.com/stepfun-ai/step1x-edit/blob/main/README.md#_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
pip install -r requirements.txt
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Conda Environment Creation
DESCRIPTION: This code snippet demonstrates how to create and activate a Conda environment using the `qwen25vl_environment.yml` file. This ensures the required dependencies are installed for running the image editing tasks.
SOURCE: https://github.com/stepfun-ai/step1x-edit/blob/main/GEdit-Bench/EVAL.md#_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
conda env create -f qwen25vl_environment.yml
conda activate qwen25vl
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Running Flash Attention Script
DESCRIPTION: This script is designed to help find the appropriate pre-built wheel for the `flash-attn` library based on the user's system configuration.  It assists in installing the `flash-attn` library, which is used for faster attention computations. The script outputs a wheel file name that can be used to download and install the correct version of `flash-attn`.
SOURCE: https://github.com/stepfun-ai/step1x-edit/blob/main/README.md#_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
python scripts/get_flash_attn.py
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Load Dataset with Hugging Face Datasets
DESCRIPTION: This Python snippet loads the GEdit-Bench dataset using the `load_dataset` function from the `datasets` library. It assumes the `datasets` library is installed in the active environment. This provides the data for image editing and evaluation.
SOURCE: https://github.com/stepfun-ai/step1x-edit/blob/main/GEdit-Bench/EVAL.md#_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: python
CODE:
```
from datasets import load_dataset
dataset = load_dataset("stepfun-ai/GEdit-Bench")
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Running Inference Examples
DESCRIPTION: This command executes the `run_examples.sh` script, which runs the inference code on example inputs to demonstrate the image editing model's capabilities. The script processes example images and generates edited outputs based on predefined instructions, showcasing the model's functionality.
SOURCE: https://github.com/stepfun-ai/step1x-edit/blob/main/README.md#_snippet_2

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
bash scripts/run_examples.sh
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Calculate Statistics
DESCRIPTION: This bash command runs the `calculate_statistics.py` script to analyze the results of the image editing evaluations. It takes the model name, path to the saved results, and backbone model as arguments, generating scores for semantics, quality, and overall performance.
SOURCE: https://github.com/stepfun-ai/step1x-edit/blob/main/GEdit-Bench/EVAL.md#_snippet_4

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
python calculate_statistics.py --model_name your_method --save_path /path/to/results --backbone gpt4o
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: GPT-4.1 Evaluation
DESCRIPTION: This bash command executes the `test_gedit_score.py` script to evaluate image edits using the GPT-4.1 model.  It specifies the model name, enables saving the results, and sets the backbone to `gpt4o`.
SOURCE: https://github.com/stepfun-ai/step1x-edit/blob/main/GEdit-Bench/EVAL.md#_snippet_2

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
python test_gedit_score.py --model_name your_method --save_path --backbone gpt4o
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Qwen2.5VL Evaluation
DESCRIPTION: This bash command executes the `test_gedit_score.py` script to evaluate image edits using the Qwen2.5VL model. It specifies the model name, enables saving the results, and sets the backbone to `qwen25vl`.
SOURCE: https://github.com/stepfun-ai/step1x-edit/blob/main/GEdit-Bench/EVAL.md#_snippet_3

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
python test_gedit_score.py --model_name your_method --save_path --backbone qwen25vl
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Generating Flash Attention Wheel Name
DESCRIPTION: This example shows the expected output of the python script that finds the pre-built wheel suitable for the users system. This wheel is then downloaded from the release page of flash-attn and installed separately. The script generates a wheel name suitable for the user's system and python version.
SOURCE: https://github.com/stepfun-ai/step1x-edit/blob/main/README.md#_snippet_3

LANGUAGE: python
CODE:
```
flash_attn-2.7.2.post1+cu12torch2.5cxx11abiFALSE-cp310-cp310-linux_x86_64.whl
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Defining Package Dependencies
DESCRIPTION: This snippet defines the required Python packages and their versions.  These packages are essential for the project to function correctly and are typically listed in a requirements.txt or similar file.  The versions specified ensure compatibility and avoid potential conflicts.
SOURCE: https://github.com/stepfun-ai/step1x-edit/blob/main/requirements.txt#_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: Python
CODE:
```
torch>=2.3.1
liger_kernel==0.5.4
einops==0.8.1
transformers==4.49.0
qwen_vl_utils==0.0.10
safetensors==0.4.5
pillow==11.1.0
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Citation Format
DESCRIPTION: This is the citation format for the Step1X-Edit project. This bibtex entry can be used to cite the paper in academic publications.
SOURCE: https://github.com/stepfun-ai/step1x-edit/blob/main/README.md#_snippet_4

LANGUAGE: default
CODE:
```
@article{liu2025step1x-edit,
      title={Step1X-Edit: A Practical Framework for General Image Editing}, 
      author={Shiyu Liu and Yucheng Han and Peng Xing and Fukun Yin and Rui Wang and Wei Cheng and Jiaqi Liao and Yingming Wang and Honghao Fu and Chunrui Han and Guopeng Li and Yuang Peng and Quan Sun and Jingwei Wu and Yan Cai and Zheng Ge and Ranchen Ming and Lei Xia and Xianfang Zeng and Yibo Zhu and Binxing Jiao and Xiangyu Zhang and Gang Yu and Daxin Jiang},
      journal={arXiv preprint arXiv:2504.17761},
      year={2025}
}
```
